
    Evidence from d+Au Measurements for Final-State Suppression of
    High-p_T Hadrons in Au+Au Collisions at RHIC
    J. Adams /et al., /Phys. Rev. Lett. *91*, 072304(2003).

------------------------------------------------------------------------


      Figure 1: 1/N_events dN/dN_ch (FTPC-Au)

Normalization is to the total number of d+Au hadronic collisions.

------------------------------------------------------------------------


      Figure 2: 1/(2?p_T ) d^2 N/dp_T d?|_|?|<0.5

Measured total p+p NSD cross-section is 30.0 mb +/- 3.5 mb

Uncertainties are the quadrature sum of statistical + systematic
uncertainties.

The inelastic p+p spectrum is obtained by applying a small p_T
-dependent correction at low p_T .
The correction is 7% at p_T = 400 MeV/c and linearly decreases to 0 at
p_T = 1.3 GeV/c.

/ To make an ascii table, save this page as plain text using your web
browser./
1/(2?p_T ) d^2 N/dp_T d?|_|?|<0.5 [(GeV/c)^-2 ]
p_T (low, high) [GeV/c] d+Au FTPC-Au 0-20% d+Au Minimum Bias p+p (NSD)
p+p (Inel)

------------------------------------------------------------------------


      Figure 3: R_AB (p_T ) = (d^2 N/dp_T d?(AB))/(T_AB d^2 ?/dp_T d?(pp))

Uncertainties are the quadrature sum of statistical + point-to-point
systematic uncertainties (Error bars in figure).
Quadrature sum of numerator and denominator normalization uncertainties
(Error bands in figure) are indicated.



/ To make an ascii table, save this page as plain text using your web
browser./
R_AB (p_T ) = (d^2 N/dp_T dh(AB))/(T_AB d^2 s/dp_T dh(pp))
p_T [GeV/c] d+Au FTPC-Au 0-20%
< N_bin > = 15.0 +/- 1.1
Normalization Uncertainty = +/- 17.4% d+Au Minimum Bias
< N_bin > = 7.5 +/- 0.4
Normalization Uncertainty = +/- 17.4% Au+Au Central
< N_bin > = 1051 +/- 71
Normalization Uncertainty = +15.5 -15.6%

------------------------------------------------------------------------


      Figure 4: 1/N_Trigger dN/d(??) (h^+ +h^- )


Au+Au central data is shown in a separate table due to different
binning. Trigger particles are selected with 4 GeV/c < p_T < 6 GeV/c,
while associated particles are selected within 2 GeV/c < p_T < p_T
(trig), with |?| < 0.7 for both sets. Only statistical errors are
listed. Normalization uncertainties are less than 5%.


/ To make an ascii table, save this page as plain text using your web
browser./

subtracted p+p Minimum Bias
